stories.text:
Hi,

I can't seem to find decent training material for the Solutions Architect Associate AWS certification. The official stuff on skillbuilder doesn't seem to cover everything you need - when I look at practise questions, I often struggle because they involve very minute details of a specific and commonly used AWS service like EC2.

My question is - for those who have done it or are thinking about doing it - what full courses would you do? Preferably not these ridiculously priced ones that are regurgitated from somewhere else anyway - I don't think the people of HN are privy to paying $5,000 for level CompTIA crap.

Another question would be whether I'm misunderstanding the point of the "Solutions Architect" certification range - is it the point that it's not full of stuff you can learn in one fell swoop?
stories.title: Ask HN: AWS Solutions Architect Associate training material
